text: Psalm 75
Thanksgiving for God’s Future Help
For the \add music\add* director, \add according to\add* Do Not Destroy.
A psalm of Asaph. A song.\f + \fr Ps 75 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
We give thanks to you, O God;
we give thanks, and your name is near.
Your wonderful deeds are told.\f + \fr 75:1 \ft Hebrew “They tell your wonderful deeds” \f*
“I will indeed set an appointed time;
I will judge fairly.\f + \fr 75:2 \ft Hebrew “I, I will judge” might be emphatic \f*
\add The\add* earth and all its inhabitants \add are\add* shaking;\f + \fr 75:3 \ft Or “melting away” \f*
I steady\f + \fr 75:3 \ft Hebrew “I, I steady” might be emphatic \f* its columns. \qs Selah\qs*
I say to the boastful, ‘Do not boast!’
and to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up \add your\add* horn!
Do not lift up high your\f + \fr 75:5 \ft Plural \f* horn.
Do \add not\add* speak with ⸤arrogant pride⸥.’ ”\f + \fr 75:5 \ft Hebrew “an unrestrained neck” \f*
For \add it is\add* not from \add the\add* east or \add the\add* west
and not from \add the\add* south\f + \fr 75:6 \ft Hebrew “wilderness” \f* \add that\add* lifting up \add comes\add*,
rather God \add is the\add* judge;
one he brings low, and another he lifts up.
For \add there is\add* a cup in the hand of Yahweh
with\f + \fr 75:8 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* wine \add that\add* foams, fully mixed,
and he pours out from this.
Surely all \add the\add* wicked of \add the\add* land
⸤will quaff it down \add to\add* its dregs⸥. \f + \fr 75:8 \ft Literally “they will drain, they will drink its dregs” \f*
But as for me, I will proclaim forever;
I will sing praise to the God of Jacob.
“And all \add the\add* horns of \add the\add* wicked I will cut off.
\add The\add* horns of \add the\add* righteous will be lifted up.”
